fields.name: child
fields.desc: The widget below this widget in the tree.

fields.name: onTapDown
fields.desc: A pointer that might cause a tap with a primary button has contacted the screen at a particular location.

fields.name: onTapUp
fields.desc: A pointer that will trigger a tap with a primary button has stopped contacting the screen at a particular location.

fields.name: onTap
fields.desc: A tap with a primary button has occurred.

fields.name: onTapMove
fields.desc: A pointer that triggered a tap has moved.

fields.name: onTapCancel
fields.desc: The pointer that previously triggered [onTapDown] will not end up causing a tap.

fields.name: onSecondaryTap
fields.desc: A tap with a secondary button has occurred.

fields.name: onSecondaryTapDown
fields.desc: A pointer that might cause a tap with a secondary button has contacted the screen at a particular location.

fields.name: onSecondaryTapUp
fields.desc: A pointer that will trigger a tap with a secondary button has stopped contacting the screen at a particular location.

fields.name: onSecondaryTapCancel
fields.desc: The pointer that previously triggered [onSecondaryTapDown] will not end up causing a tap.

fields.name: onTertiaryTapDown
fields.desc: A pointer that might cause a tap with a tertiary button has contacted the screen at a particular location.

fields.name: onTertiaryTapUp
fields.desc: A pointer that will trigger a tap with a tertiary button has stopped contacting the screen at a particular location.

fields.name: onTertiaryTapCancel
fields.desc: The pointer that previously triggered [onTertiaryTapDown] will not end up causing a tap.

fields.name: onDoubleTapDown
fields.desc: A pointer that might cause a double tap has contacted the screen at a particular location.

fields.name: onDoubleTap
fields.desc: The user has tapped the screen with a primary button at the same location twice in quick succession.

fields.name: onDoubleTapCancel
fields.desc: The pointer that previously triggered [onDoubleTapDown] will not end up causing a double tap.

fields.name: onLongPressDown
fields.desc: The pointer has contacted the screen with a primary button, which might be the start of a long-press.

fields.name: onLongPressCancel
fields.desc: A pointer that previously triggered [onLongPressDown] will not end up causing a long-press.

fields.name: onLongPress
fields.desc: Called when a long press gesture with a primary button has been recognized.

fields.name: onLongPressStart
fields.desc: Called when a long press gesture with a primary button has been recognized.

fields.name: onLongPressMoveUpdate
fields.desc: A pointer has been drag-moved after a long-press with a primary button.

fields.name: onLongPressUp
fields.desc: A pointer that has triggered a long-press with a primary button has stopped contacting the screen.

fields.name: onLongPressEnd
fields.desc: A pointer that has triggered a long-press with a primary button has stopped contacting the screen.

fields.name: onSecondaryLongPressDown
fields.desc: The pointer has contacted the screen with a secondary button, which might be the start of a long-press.

fields.name: onSecondaryLongPressCancel
fields.desc: A pointer that previously triggered [onSecondaryLongPressDown] will not end up causing a long-press.

fields.name: onSecondaryLongPress
fields.desc: Called when a long press gesture with a secondary button has been recognized.

fields.name: onSecondaryLongPressStart
fields.desc: Called when a long press gesture with a secondary button has been recognized.

fields.name: onSecondaryLongPressMoveUpdate
fields.desc: A pointer has been drag-moved after a long press with a secondary button.

fields.name: onSecondaryLongPressUp
fields.desc: A pointer that has triggered a long-press with a secondary button has stopped contacting the screen.

fields.name: onSecondaryLongPressEnd
fields.desc: A pointer that has triggered a long-press with a secondary button has stopped contacting the screen.

fields.name: onTertiaryLongPressDown
fields.desc: The pointer has contacted the screen with a tertiary button, which might be the start of a long-press.

fields.name: onTertiaryLongPressCancel
fields.desc: A pointer that previously triggered [onTertiaryLongPressDown] will not end up causing a long-press.

fields.name: onTertiaryLongPress
fields.desc: Called when a long press gesture with a tertiary button has been recognized.

fields.name: onTertiaryLongPressStart
fields.desc: Called when a long press gesture with a tertiary button has been recognized.

fields.name: onTertiaryLongPressMoveUpdate
fields.desc: A pointer has been drag-moved after a long press with a tertiary button.

fields.name: onTertiaryLongPressUp
fields.desc: A pointer that has triggered a long-press with a tertiary button has stopped contacting the screen.

fields.name: onTertiaryLongPressEnd
fields.desc: A pointer that has triggered a long-press with a tertiary button has stopped contacting the screen.

fields.name: onVerticalDragDown
fields.desc: A pointer has contacted the screen with a primary button and might begin to move vertically.

fields.name: onVerticalDragStart
fields.desc: A pointer has contacted the screen with a primary button and has begun to move vertically.

fields.name: onVerticalDragUpdate
fields.desc: A pointer that is in contact with the screen with a primary button and moving vertically has moved in the vertical direction.

fields.name: onVerticalDragEnd
fields.desc: A pointer that was previously in contact with the screen with a primary button and moving vertically is no longer in contact with the screen and was moving at a specific velocity when it stopped contacting the screen.

fields.name: onVerticalDragCancel
fields.desc: The pointer that previously triggered [onVerticalDragDown] did not complete.

fields.name: onHorizontalDragDown
fields.desc: A pointer has contacted the screen with a primary button and might begin to move horizontally.

fields.name: onHorizontalDragStart
fields.desc: A pointer has contacted the screen with a primary button and has begun to move horizontally.

fields.name: onHorizontalDragUpdate
fields.desc: A pointer that is in contact with the screen with a primary button and moving horizontally has moved in the horizontal direction.

fields.name: onHorizontalDragEnd
fields.desc: A pointer that was previously in contact with the screen with a primary button and moving horizontally is no longer in contact with the screen and was moving at a specific velocity when it stopped contacting the screen.

fields.name: onHorizontalDragCancel
fields.desc: The pointer that previously triggered [onHorizontalDragDown] did not complete.

fields.name: onPanDown
fields.desc: A pointer has contacted the screen with a primary button and might begin to move.

fields.name: onPanStart
fields.desc: A pointer has contacted the screen with a primary button and has begun to move.

fields.name: onPanUpdate
fields.desc: A pointer that is in contact with the screen with a primary button and moving has moved again.

fields.name: onPanEnd
fields.desc: A pointer that was previously in contact with the screen with a primary button and moving is no longer in contact with the screen and was moving at a specific velocity when it stopped contacting the screen.

fields.name: onPanCancel
fields.desc: The pointer that previously triggered [onPanDown] did not complete.

fields.name: onScaleStart
fields.desc: The pointers in contact with the screen have established a focal point and initial scale of 1.0.

fields.name: onScaleUpdate
fields.desc: The pointers in contact with the screen have indicated a new focal point and/or scale.

fields.name: onScaleEnd
fields.desc: The pointers are no longer in contact with the screen.

fields.name: onForcePressStart
fields.desc: The pointer is in contact with the screen and has pressed with sufficient force to initiate a force press. The amount of force is at least [ForcePressGestureRecognizer.startPressure].

fields.name: onForcePressPeak
fields.desc: The pointer is in contact with the screen and has pressed with the maximum force. The amount of force is at least [ForcePressGestureRecognizer.peakPressure].

fields.name: onForcePressUpdate
fields.desc: A pointer is in contact with the screen, has previously passed the [ForcePressGestureRecognizer.startPressure] and is either moving on the plane of the screen, pressing the screen with varying forces or both simultaneously.

fields.name: onForcePressEnd
fields.desc: The pointer tracked by [onForcePressStart] is no longer in contact with the screen.

fields.name: behavior
fields.desc: How this gesture detector should behave during hit testing when deciding how the hit test propagates to children and whether to consider targets behind this one.

fields.name: excludeFromSemantics
fields.desc: Whether to exclude these gestures from the semantics tree. For example, the long-press gesture for showing a tooltip is excluded because the tooltip itself is included in the semantics tree directly and so having a gesture to show it would result in duplication of information.

fields.name: dragStartBehavior
fields.desc: Determines the way that drag start behavior is handled.

fields.name: supportedDevices
fields.desc: The kind of devices that are allowed to be recognized.

fields.name: trackpadScrollCausesScale
fields.desc: {@macro flutter.gestures.scale.trackpadScrollCausesScale}

fields.name: trackpadScrollToScaleFactor
fields.desc: {@macro flutter.gestures.scale.trackpadScrollToScaleFactor}
